channel.title: Comments on: AV Club / Our home setup 2012

item.title: By: michaelkant
item.dc:creator: michaelkant
item.description:
I also recently switched from WHS2011 to Windows 8. Loving no-ip.com as well! Its a suitable replacement for the built in functionality of WHS2011.
Regarding streaming from the Storage Spaces pool, I set up my media folder within the pool as a Library, and once all my home PCs were setup on the Homegroup, everything has been streaming perfectly.

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/1773/comment-page-1#comment-20361">David Hollifield</a>.
I haven't had the problem you're having with streamed/ripped DVDs (as I haven't tried it). However, my thought on that would be to potentially store the DVD images on a non-Storage Space drive (so you get better speed potentially), and use File History to back them up to another drive. I'm using File History in a similar way (but not for media files like you suggest).

item.title: By: David Hollifield
item.dc:creator: David Hollifield
item.description: Nice setup. I have a lot of the same. Yours is more elaborate and I'm going to borrow ideas. One question though. I also recently upgraded my WHS 2011 to Windows 8 Pro. I very much like Windows 8, but found the Storage Spaces to be unusable as a source of streaming movies. I use My Movies to stream ripped DVDs from my server to my HTPC and this just would not work with Storage Spaces. It would play for a few seconds then just stop. I removed the Storage Spaces and streaming worked again. Have you experienced anything like that?
